title: Goalie Spotlight: Guy Blessing has been everything the Air Force Falcons have needed and more this season | Sports | gazette.com
text:
Search Share This Close Air Force goalie Guy Blessing, who is second in Atlantic Hockey America in saves, contests a shot on goal by Niagara University's Shane Ott.
Alexander Edwards, The Gazette Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save
Goalie Spotlight: Guy Blessing has been everything the Air Force Falcons have needed and more this season Jan 16, 2025 Jan 16, 2025 Updated 10 hrs ago Air Force goalie Guy Blessing, who is second in Atlantic Hockey America in saves, contests a shot on goal by Niagara University's Shane Ott.
Alexander Edwards, The Gazette Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Season totals : Three shutouts, .917 saves percentage (fifth of 11 in Atlantic Hockey America conference), 576 saves (second)
The nation's leader in minutes played among goaltenders per College Hockey News , Air Force's Guy Blessing is having exactly the season Falcons coach Frank Serratore envisioned.
The senior goaltender has often been the best player on an Air Force team that has allowed the fewest goals in conference play with just 21.
Blessing leads Atlantic Hockey in conference play in saves percentage (.953) and goals against average (1.25).
He credits his defensemen with his success.
Sign Up for Pikes Peak 5 Game analysis and insights from The Gazette sports staff including columns by Woody Paige and Paul Klee.
Sign Up View all of our newsletters.
Success! Thank you for subscribing to our newsletter. View all of our newsletters. Featured Local Savings "The D-corps has been fantastic this year and I've been blessed to have that my entire three years playing here," he said. "We got some really skilled guys on the blue line, and to see our freshmen and sophomore defensemen especially, to be playing the way that they are with as few games as we've played has been extremely impressive, and it helps me to be a lot more calm out there."
Blessing began 2025 with a bang, earning his third shoutout of the season in a 3-0 win against conference-leading Sacred Heart on Jan. 4. This past weekend, he allowed just two goals on 65 shots against Bentley, Atlantic Hockey's second-best team.
He said the wins against the league's best have been huge for the Falcons' confidence.
"Air Force has always been a second-half team and any chance we get to build momentum is enormous," Blessing said. "Especially, to come out of these weekends with a Saturday win and then treating that like a playoff series, we'd be going into Game 3 with that momentum is enormous. So any chance we to generate that among the boys is massive and it's just really cool to see."
